Package totalcross.lang

IMPORTANT: the totalcross.lang package is the java.lang that will be used in the device.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AutoCloseable
    An object that may hold resources (such as file or socket handles) until it is closed.
    Cloneable
    This interface should be implemented by classes wishing to support of override Object.clone().
    Comparable<T>
    Interface for objects that can be ordering among other objects.
    Iterable<E>
    This interface is used to indicate that a given class can be iterated over.
    Runnable
    Used to implement a thread in a class that already extends other class.

    Number
    Number is a generic superclass of all the numeric classes, including the wrapper classes Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, and Double.
    NumberFormatException
    Thrown when an invalid number was passed to valueOf.
    Object
    totalcross.lang.Object is the base class for all objects.
    OutOfMemoryError

    Umbrella exception for exceptions when using reflection.

    General runtime exception class.
    SecurityException
    This exception is used in reflection and is actually never thrown.
    Short  
    String
    totalcross.lang.String is an immutable array of characters.
    StringBuffer
    This class is a growable buffer for characters.
    StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
    Thrown when you try to create a totalcross.lang.String using the constructor that receives a byte array, an offset and the length.
    Thread

    Throwable
    Base class of all Exceptions.
    UnsupportedOperationException
    This exception is thrown by an object when an operation is requested of it that it does not support.
    Void  

Package totalcross.lang Description

IMPORTANT: the totalcross.lang package is the java.lang that will be used in the device. You CANNOT use nor import totalcross.lang package in desktop. When tc.Deploy is called, all references to java.lang are replaced by totalcross.lang automatically. Given this, you must use only the classes and methods that exists BOTH in java.lang and totalcross.lang. For example, you can't use totalcross.lang.ClassLoader because there are no totalcross.lang.ClassLoader. Another example, you can't use totalcross.lang.String.indexOfIgnoreCase because there are no totalcross.lang.String.indexOfIgnoreCase method. Trying to use a class or method from the java.lang package that has no correspondence with totalcross.lang will make the tc.Deploy program to abort, informing where the problem occured. A good idea is to always refer to this javadoc to know what is and what isn't available.
